step1.sentence: After hiking for three hours in the summer heat, that ice-cold lemonade really hit the spot.

step2.story: Maya had been craving something warm and comforting all day. When she finally sat down with a bowl of her grandmother's homemade chicken soup, it absolutely hit the spot. She closed her eyes and smiled, feeling the warmth spread through her whole body.

step3.story: It had been one of those brutal Monday mornings—back-to-back meetings, a broken coffee machine, and a skipped lunch. By 3 PM, Daniel was running on fumes and desperately needed a pick-me-up. His coworker Sarah noticed his exhaustion and handed him a warm cup of freshly brewed coffee from the café downstairs. He took one sip and sighed with relief—it completely hit the spot. The rich, smooth flavor was exactly what he needed to power through the rest of the afternoon. Sometimes, the smallest gestures make the biggest difference.

meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 음식이나 음료, 또는 어떤 행동이 그 순간 자신이 원하던 것과 딱 맞아떨어질 때 사용합니다. '딱 좋다', '정말 만족스럽다'는 의미로 주로 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 19세기 미국 영어에서 유래한 표현으로, 원래 과녁의 정중앙(spot)을 맞히다(hit)라는 사격 비유에서 발전하여 '정확히 원하는 것을 충족시키다'라는 의미로 확장되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 주로 긍정적이고 편안한 상황에서 사용되며, 특히 음식이나 음료에 대한 만족감을 표현할 때 가장 자연스럽습니다. 격식 없는 일상 대화에서 자주 쓰이는 친근한 표현입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: A hot shower after a long day really hits the spot.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 긴 하루를 보낸 후 뜨거운 샤워는 정말 딱이에요.
